newsitem.title: UK: HTV sees strong independent future.
newsitem.headline: HTV sees strong independent future.

text.p: British regional television broadcaster HTV group said on Friday that despite United News & Media's stake in the company rising to 29.9 percent, it saw a strong independent future for itself.
United News & Media announced on Friday it had acquired 8.7 million shares at 420 pence each and had thus raised its holding in HTV to 26.35 million shares representing 29.9 percent.
HTV operates as an independent television franchise operator in Wales and the west of England. It is a major licensee of ITV.
In a statement the company said: "HTV continues to see a strong independent future for the company and will continue to manage the business in the best interests of all its shareholders".
HTV recently became a bid target with speculation focused on ITV broadcasting giants Carlton Communications or United News.
United News took an edge a few weeks ago by buying out a 19.99 percent stake from Scottish Television for 73.7 million stg.
